whyFlywheels.title: Why Flywheels
whyFlywheels.subtitle: Our wedge in the energy stack

points.title: Lithium is energy
points.description: Batteries excel at storing large amounts of energy over hours and days

points.title: Flywheels are power
points.description: Kinetic storage delivers instant, high-power response for seconds to minutes

points.title: Both are needed
points.description: Data centers and industrial sites need both energy capacity and power responsiveness

points.title: Our wedge: 0-5 minutes
points.description: The volatility window where batteries degrade rapidly but flywheels thrive - unlimited cycles, no capacity loss

whyFlywheels.callout: On The Fly Energy targets the 0-5 minute volatility window that batteries alone are poorly suited for - where cycle life, C-rates, and degradation make lithium uneconomical. This is about system-level positioning, not replacing batteries, but complementing them.

progress.title: Where We Are Now
progress.subtitle: Honest progress from serious adults doing hard things

milestones.title: Foundations: Core Technology Integration
milestones.description: First integrated kinetic storage module combining high-speed rotor with custom 5 kW grid-tie inverter. Rotor-Seed V1/V2 prototypes, inverter demonstration with sub-second response, hybrid operation with lithium, early telemetry through Factory-OS, federal innovation program submissions.

milestones.title: From Prototype to Pilot-Ready Systems
milestones.description: Engineering discipline phase: Rotor-Seed V3 with improved bearings and containment validation, Inverter V2 with enhanced control loops, first hybrid kinetic-plus-lithium demo, failure mode modeling, defined architecture for Rotor-Pod (20-30 kW class).

milestones.title: Pilot Site Engineering + LOIs
milestones.description: Lock final Rotor-Pod design, develop BOM and installation workflow, initiate UL 1741-SB and IEEE 1547 certification, sign pilot commitments with early-adopter customers in AI and industrial sectors, expand Factory-OS monitoring for fleet management.

milestones.title: Pilot Deployment #1
milestones.description: Deploy first pilot system to live customer environment. Demonstrate ride-through, peak-shaving, and fast power-balancing. Characterize efficiency and dispatch speed. Validate integration with existing systems. Train ML models on rotor health. Publish performance summaries.

milestones.title: Scaling Toward Modular Energy Infrastructure
milestones.description: 50-250 kW Rotor-Pod variants, containerized Rotor-Plant systems, full API integration for data center orchestration and grid services, certification and manufacturability, high-volume composite rotor production, industrial and utility partnerships.

progress.footer: We are not overclaiming. This is early-stage hard tech, and we are methodically de-risking the path to a working, deployable product.
